item.description:
This takes secondary importance to the Primary day handouts that we
are trying to do, but coming up on Saturday the 13th is a cool
opportunity for those who love NASCAR, or wish they could donate to a
pro-freedom candidate, but can't because the bills are tight.

The New Hampshire Liberty Alliance volunteers each September race day
at the track in Loundon, NH, when NASCAR comes to town. For each
person that volunteers to be an usher, the NHLA gets money (which goes
100% into the Political Action Fund and will be used to fund
candidates for this November).

And if we get over a certain number of people there that day, our
money gets a power-up (like the mushroom in Mario)!

So this is a call out: ANYONE who has Sept 13th free, e-mail me
(shuvom@comcast. net) or Carol Mcguire (treasurer@nhliberty .org) if you
want to:
1. Get a free pass to feel souped up cars fly by you at 200+ MPH
2. Help with our biggest fundraiser of the year for deserving liberty
candidates in NH.

Warning: the day is long, and you will be in the sun and loud noise
for a good part of it. I did this event two years ago (had to skip
last year because of my wedding) and was glad I brought two sets of
earplugs and water. But I can still feel my chest vibrating from
those monsters flying by! It's a rush!

***
Every person that shows up means more money for liberty candidates.
Ask you friends to join up.
The more the merrier!
item.name: NHLA day at the races
